lexUnit.name: write up.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: write a full account of something

sentence.text: All of this was already mapped out in a very decent and proper piece of research that I had just written up .
Perhaps , with this sense of purpose still fresh upon you , you decide that the notes taken during lectures will be " written up " in your room -- when ?
I 've got notes to write up and Madame Gebrec 's book to read . "
Versions of it in prose and rhyme had been written up while he was still at Gastons .
It got a lot of airplay from John Peel , and was written up extensively by the music press .
There is a good programme of daily activities in the Home , and all these are written up on a large board in Peter 's office .
All this data is then written up as a technical report , and forms part of the information stored as an archive for future reference .
Travelling home by train after visiting a virgin site , he would write up his notes and sketch out a design while the memory was still fresh .
Finally , I finished a recording for home and wrote up the log .
It is often a good idea to write up your own notes of a disciplinary interview immediately afterwards .
Newspaper reporters do this all the time and what is often these days called ` investigative journalism " may use teams of interviewers who together write up full-page reports on chosen topics .
` You write up the more interesting parts of what they say and leave out the dull bits to do them a favour -- if you like them .
He wrote up the names of all trainees on the white board , and at the end of the day , he wrote up the sales scores of each one .
Shelley wrote up the case and put the files away .
I 'm going to write up a suggested arrangement on the board now .
If you are given this task it is best to write the minutes up the same day or as soon as possible after the meeting while the discussion is still fresh in your mind .
